title: Secretary's Day
description: Michael creates problems for Andy on Secretary's Day when he tells Erin that Andy was engaged to Angela, and Kevin is upset after Oscar makes a video comparing Kevin to Cookie Monster.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Andy, Angela, Phyllis, Ryan, Kelly, and Oscar are gathered around Oscar's computer lauging at a video of Cookie Monster]

quotes.speaker: Cookie Monster
quotes.text: [Kevin's voice] Oscar, Toby said he left my Girl Scout cookies on my chair. Have you seen them? Wait I'm sitting on them. [all laugh]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is awesome!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thank you. It didn't even take that long.

quotes.speaker: Cookie Monster
quotes.text: [Kevin's voice] What's the difference between a chimichanga, [Kevin arrives behind the group] a chalupa, and a tostada? Call me back ASAP. It's urgent.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This isn't funny. I don't talk like that. [all continue laughing]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Say "Me eat cookie."

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No. I won't say it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why is everyone clumped around accounting? Break it up, you clique.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's Kevin as Cookie monster from Sesame Street.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [gets up and starts to walk to Oscar's desk] Is that the program where all those puppets live in the barrio?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I love that show.

quotes.speaker: Cookie Monster
quotes.text: [Kevin's voice] This is Kevin. This is Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Good work, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is an amusing link. I'd like it sent to me, please.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Me, too Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: C.C. me

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Angela, this is inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is my favorite day.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's Secretary's Day. And it is Erin's and my three-week anniversary. So perfect storm for a romantic gesture. [Andy unfurling a giant "Happy Secretary's Day" banner by reception, placing a teddy bear on Erin's chair]. Want to make sure the whole office remembers it's Secretary's Day. I sent an e-mail blast, a text blast, a good, old-fashioned talk blast. I sent a snail mail blast a week ago.  And a Stern reminder via fax at 7:00 this morning, so people better step up and appreciate the crap out of Erin.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [hands Erin a basket of beets]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If it wasn't for secretaries, I wouldn't have a stepmom.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [as Halperts arrive] Welcome back!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's my first day back after maternity leave. And I miss Cece, of course. But we need the money. What was maternity leave like? Oh, how do I explain it?... It rocked. It rocked my ass off.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [at her desk, grabs her plant and sees it dried up, looks at Jim] Oh. You couldn't have watered it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I literally did not know that existed until this moment.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, I knew it existed, and I chose to let it die.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's nice to see you again, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [arrives at Michael's office and sits] I was just wondering what you had planned for Secretary's Day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going to give Erin $15.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I know that Erin would be so psyched if you took her out to lunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A one-on-one lunch with Erin?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. She really looks up to you. And there's only so much we can do as her coworkers. Secretary's Day is really kind of a boss-secretary thing. [Michael glances over at Erin in reception, Erin waves her teddy bear's arm at Michael].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She's kind of a rube.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [slams his hand on Michael's desk] That's my girlfriend you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. All right. All right. Okay. I'll take her to lunch.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [taping desk] She's gonna be so psyched.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks over to Erin's desk] Hi, Erin. Happy Secretary's Day.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, happy Boss's day. There wouldn't be a secretary if there was no boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wanted to know what your plans for lunch were because I was hoping to ask you to...[Erin snaps a picture of Michael] lunch.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I got a picture of you asking me to lunch. I was thinking we could go to Hayworth's.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Just the two of us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Hayworth's is more business casual, and they always screw up your order. So I'm...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, okay. Yeah that was a stupid suggestion. I was thinking someplace special, so I though Hayworth's, but...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, we'll figure something. [Michael turns and starts back toward his office]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looks at Andy who is urging he agree with her, Michael turns around] Okay, let's go to Hayworth's.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [cheerfully] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [sitting at kitchen table with Darryl] Have a cookie, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, haha. Tray of cookies. I'm not falling for that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I brought those in. It's my birthday.  That's some stone-cold narcissism right there.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Man, Darryl, I'm sorry. [pats Darryl's back] Happy Birthday.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thank you. [Kevin grabs cookie and starts eating it]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [as Cookie Monster] Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: They're making fun of Cookie Monster. I get that. But in a strange way, it feels like they're making fun of me.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [again on laptop as Cookie Monster as he shows Gabe the video] Oscar, did you eat some of my M&M's? The level...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: This is violent and offensive.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you. [computer continues] It really makes me self-conscious about my voice.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: It's awful. [reaches for tissue box, hands it to Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm not crying.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You have some food on your face.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [on computer as Cookie Monster] Do my hands feel sweaty to you? [Kevin grabs a tissue and wipes his mouth]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: The beginning here has been a little bit of a fiasco. Either they don't respect me or they respect me too much. And some of them still think that I'm the I.T. guy. This Cookie Monster thing is an opportunity to show people that I'm an authority figure.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hello, everyone. If I might have a moment of your time. It's come to my attention that people have been watching and laughing at a hurtful parody video. It is now forbidden to talk, joke about, or e-mail this around.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: And that's straight from corporate. So not to be scary, but yeah, I would listen to me. And that's all. Ciao.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in his car with Erin driving to lunch] Would you mind if I listen to my book on tape? I'm kind of a bookworm. This is the novelization of the movie Precious based on the book Push by Sapphire.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I was thinking it would be fun to talk on the way over. So what decade would you have chosen to be a teenager?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [shakes head, annoyed] I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I would have chosen the 1490's.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahhh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: 'Cause America was discovered.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [at lunch] And then my last job was at a Taco Bell express. But then it became a full Taco Bell, and I don't know, I couldn't keep up. My favorite part about being a receptionist is that I get to have my own desk. In my Foster home I never had a desk. [Michael keeps moving around, very clearly bored and annoyed]. So it's like... I don't mean that I didn't like my foster home. I did like it. I just didn't have a desk there. Did you have a favorite age? Or month?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: An age or month?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, like a favorite month. Like I like April when I was seven.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've been trying. I've been trying to keep it going. Erin is just weird.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: How many pillows do you sleep on at night?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So how are things going with Andy?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's the best boyfriend in the world. Tell me about him before I met him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, let's see. Um... Andy. Plays the banjo.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah I love that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Other than the fact that he dated Angela, I don't think he is a snappy dresser.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't think he is the best dresser.  Reminds me of Easter.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry. About Angela? Did you say he dated Angela?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm. You didn't know that? Oh.

quotes.speaker: Hayworth's Waiter
quotes.text: Here we go. Hot plate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Hayworth's Waiter
quotes.text: And your salad, miss.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Why wouldn't he tell me that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know. Probably didn't want you to have a mental image of him having sex with somebody else.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: They had sex?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They were engaged, so... [Erin looks shocked] Okay, you know what, sir?

quotes.speaker: Hayworth's Waiter
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I asked for pickles with my burger. And there are only, like five or six. Could I get some more pickles?

quotes.speaker: Hayworth's Waiter
quotes.text: Of course. I'll get you a bowl of pickles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uhhhh, they were engaged?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [face looks disgusted, moves around uncomfortably] Uh-oh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [moans, pulls hair over her face]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing? What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: In the Foster home, my hair was my room. [exhales, prolonged exclaiming]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay. You know what? You know what? You know what? Everybody's looking at you right now.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [breathes heavily, groans]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [turns to other restaurant patrons] I'll have what she's having!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in Michael's car] Did you have a... did you like your lunch? Did you have a good lunch? Did you like that? Did you enjoy your food? It was good. I liked my lunch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [feels a pain in her breast] Ooh. Ah-ah-ah. Ha-ha.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Her milk is coming in. She's getting uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, don't be gross.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, he's right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Same thing happens with my cows if I don't tend them frequently enough. You gotta milk them, or else they'll moo like crazy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's weird, my breast pump is missing. Have you seen my breast pump?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [removes jacket, applies hand sanitizer] All right, this is gonna traumatize me a hell of a lot more than you, believe me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know what, Dwight? Let me just check the bathroom first. Okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really? Fine. Let your breasts explode. Three squeezes and I would drain you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm. [walks into bathroom, Meredith is using her brest pump] Meredith!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I just like the way it feels.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you doing?!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Just relax. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Relax?!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: This is like the Cadillac of pumps.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Give it back to me now.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Okay, I was just warming it up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's disgusting!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: It's not a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's not sterile!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: We're both girls. Who cares?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So... how was lunch?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Lunch was fine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Was it everything that you hoped and dreamed it might be?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know. It was lunch, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I know. [stammers] Just want... I mean... [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Erin? I think we're out of fax cover sheets.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: God, Oscar, will you keep your pants on? It's easy.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [using a Cookie Monster voice] "My name is Kevin, I'm an accountant." See I did the voice.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's a little derivative.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But parody is always derivative.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, it's not organic. Do you know what I mean?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim does a really good one. Do yours.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, guys. I really refuse to participate. "Michael, can I have an advance on my paycheck because a Mrs. Fields Cookie just opened up at the mall."

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Guys, why don't we leave the parodies to the pros at Mad TV?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Sorry, Gabe, but that show hasn't been on in many cookies."

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey. Can I have your attention please? First of all, thanks to everyone for helping put this awesome party together. And a very special shout-out to the chair of the Party Planning Committee, miss Angela Martin. You have outdone yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, I think we can all agree that Angela's not so great, so..

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am saying the exact opposite. Angela is fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Specific shout-out..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop talking.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok. As some of you may know, I have a very special connection with Secretary's Day in the form of that 115 pound moonbeam over there named Erin Hannon. To a lot of you she may just be the person who brings you your fax comformations. But to me, she is my girlfriend... in addition to being the person who brings me my fax comformations. So I wrote [starts to use a British accent] a little ditty. That I would like to play for all of you right now. It's a little tune called Secretary of Love. A one, a two, a one, two, three..

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [throws a piece of cake at Andy's face] I know about Angela! I know that you were engaged to her and that you were sleeping with her! Michael told me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can we talk about this in private?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't want to be in private. Is it true or is it not?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Who else did you sleep with? Did you sleep with Phyllis or Kelly or Pam? Maybe all together?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no never.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Did everyone know? Was I the only one who didn't know?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah pretty much.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Who are you?! I don't know you! [pushes someone away to leave]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I should probably get involved in this, but I think my energy is better spent on the Cookie Monster issue.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Erin, you know, if I had been engaged to anyone before you, I would've told you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So if you need anything, I'm right over there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [imitating Cookie Monster] "Hey, Erin, You look delicious. I mean, beautiful."

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ok. Ok there. I heard that. So I'm sorry, Pam, but that's it. I'm going to have to suspend you without pay for two days.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? What do you mean, suspend me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you need to go a little easy. You can't just suspend someone form work.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah, you're right. You know what? Um, you're suspended too Jim. [Dwight starts to clap] Ok fine. You too Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, What? I was just slow-clapping your no-nonsense decision-making.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I don't want to hear it. Suspended.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: "C" is for suspension.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why would that be something to talk about on Secretary's Day?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andy, she's not the easiest person in the world to have a conversation with. All right? And besides, who doesn't tell their girlfriend that they were engaged to someone who works four feet away from them? That's like.. that's like Mr. and Mrs. Smith crap.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was going to tell her, just on my own time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, I resent the implication that I would keep that secret. Everyone here knows that I can't and won't keep a secret.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who cares? I mean it's not like I killed someone. Big deal right? This can blow over in two seconds. She never asked me. So, if you think about it... I probably should have told her I guess. Everybody does stupid things.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Psst. Hey. Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You want to talk to me, come to my desk.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You embarrassed me earlier.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. Take it up with the chief of police.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You think I want people remembering I had sensual relations with Andy? It's the kind of thing you wish you could have annulled. I want to throw up just thinking about it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I want to throw up just thinking about it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You are throwing up for the wrong reasons!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [standing behind Erin] I don't think this fax is going through. Is there a different... I can just put it through again, you know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey. You know I was engaged before Jim.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. And he worked here too.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It was Andy, wasn't it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no it wasn't Andy. It wasn't. It doesn't matter. It's not about who you've been with. It's about who you end up with. Sometimes the heart doesn't know what it wants until it finds what it wants.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I hope you find what you're looking for.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you. [kisses Jim on the cheek]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [talking on the phone] So I can reprimand them but I can't suspend them. Oh I can't do either. Uh huh. Fair enough.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [answers phone] Hey Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I called Tallahassee. He can ask you not to come in, but he can't dock your pay. That's not legal.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Very interesting.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, I also learned some interesting things about how they structure...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Gabe walks in] Thanks Toby.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey everyone. Hi. Quite an afternoon, huh? Cathartic in a way. I'm glad I got to share it with you. It makes you think about what's really important. [Pam hands Jim a note] It's not about showing you're in charge or flexing some sort of authority. It's about forgiveness. And yes, I'm talking about you three in this desk clump right here. I think that, if you were to apologize to me, then I would revoke your suspension.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think an apology is enough. I really think the only way for me to learn my lesson is to take my suspension.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I got to take this bad attitude, and I got to go home, and I got to adjust it. And I hope the suspension does that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [gets up and walks towards Gabe] Prideful idiots. Watch how it's done. [Jim and Pam get their things together and start to leave] Gabriel, I apologize.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [gets on one knee] I kneel before you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Guys, I would even take a contrite look as an apology.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Humbly taking your hand upon which I kiss to show my contrition.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [following Jim and Pam to their car] Guys, to err is human. [trying to block their car]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Trust is the most important thing to me. Is your name Andy Bernard? What's your real name? Lionel Frankenstein?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Will you stop walking for one second? That's it. There's no other secrets. Ok? I mean yeah, my chest is not naturally hairless, and my parents pay my credit card bill.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: How long were you guys together?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A year.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: A year? You were together for a year?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah but that's it. Now you know everything about me. I promise. And if I think of anything else...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I think I have to be on my own for a little bit. Like the girl Precious in Precious. Based on the novel Push by Sapphire. Ok?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I didn't see that movie.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [walking back into the office] That was ugly. I'm sorry you had to see that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Do they still get paid?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: It's tacky to discuss finances. It's best to pretend that this never happened.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Sounds like they just got to go home with pay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Pathetic.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Can I buy everyone coffees? [everyone shakes their heads] [in Cookie Monster voice] "Or cookies."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What was that? Are you kidding me? Was that an impression?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [imitating Gabe] Uh guys, I'm now going to apologize for the mess that we're in because corporate told me to. I just want you to know that I laugh like a crazy person.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You got to be able to laugh at yourself. I'm one of the gang.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "I have to go back to the zoo to the stick insect exhibit."

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: "Ciao" Right? "Ciao. I say Ciao because I'm fancy from Tallahassee."

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Why don't we say ciao to the impressions? [everyone says ciao]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [sitting on bench outside groaning]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Erin?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. Sorry I thought everyone was gone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, I was just watching Cookie Monster. It finally downloaded. Mind if I sit down?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I can't trust Andy anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Yep. I'm sorry about that. I feel... I'm sorry I caused that thing.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's Andy's fault.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah, yes. But I still feel sorry. You know what, I wouldn't worry about Angela. She doesn't hold a candle to you, Erin. She's old enough to be your mom for one thing. And she's, like, three feet tall. And she wears pioneer women clothing. And I don't think she's ever pooped in her life. And Andy, you know, come on. Andy, his butt looks big in those khakis.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, I like his butt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You said butt.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You tricked me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahh! You said it! You know who you would love? Oh, this guy in my neighborhood, Tom Dizemore. This is him:

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sometimes telling someone something is hard. Well, at least someone made her happy on Secretary's Day.

quotes.speaker: {oscar}'s voice from the computer
quotes.text: Hey Kevin it's Oscar. I'm looking at the sheet you sent me. And I can't seem to find the column for shipping cost.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I made the most brilliant retaliation video. It's awesome.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't get it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean, the Count has a very distinct voice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. "I vant to count to ten".

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But Oscar is an accountant, and the Count counts numbers.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But you're an accountant too.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why didn't you do Oscar the Grouch?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That would have been funny.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But the Count is purple and Oscar wears purple.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walking up] Oh, oh, I was just watching that. Did you do that, man? "Oscar. I am the Count." Nailed him. Nailed him. [Gives Kevin a fist pump] Good work Cookie Monster.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you.
